intro: Boehmeria rugosa, commonly known as roughleaf nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine, and the fibers of its stems can be processed into textiles. Boehmeria rugosa plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
